revised_title: Investigation of Single-Channel Currents from Recombinant NMDA NR1a/NR2D Receptors in Xenopus Oocytes
tldr: The study investigates the single-channel currents and properties of recombinant NMDA NR1a/NR2D receptors expressed in Xenopus oocytes. The researchers found that the EC50 for apparent steady-state activation of NR1a/NR2D receptors by glutamate was 450 nM, and extracellular Mg2+ produced a voltage-dependent block of glutamate responses with an IC50 of 440 µM at -70 mV. The study provides insights into the single-channel conductance and behavior of these receptors, which can help in understanding their role in the central nervous system.
